name: whew
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used when you are happy that something difficult or dangerous has finished or is not going to happen: Whew! It's over and we don't have to think about it any more. Whew, I finally made it to the end of the book. He came out of the interview and went, whew, that was tough. Whew, that was close. I thought that car was going to hit us.
used to express surprise, pleasure, or admiration: When she was asked how much she earns now, she smiled and said, "Whew, that's pretty personal". Whew! What a voice! "Watching that boy play yesterday - whew ! - he is going to be something special," he said.
used to show that you are, or a place is, hot and uncomfortable: Whew, it was hot - 100 degrees.
used to show that you feel tired: Whew! I need a break. Whew, that was a lot of work. Whew, busy week! Compare
phew

an expression that shows you are surprised, tired, or relieved (= happy that something worrying you is not going to happen)
